TopicTitle: Damn, it's a big space plane.

Articles.Content:
It's huge. It's able to reach the orbit. It's hard to control. It's useless. It's awesome.

Details: 366

 Crew: 2

 Price: 1005377

 Weight: 1430 (take-off), 430 (in orbit)

Used mods: TweekScale

**There are subtitles.**

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fkHXpHiB6aE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> No offence, but it's useless

I think a kinder term might be "functionally challenged".

> 
> I think a kinder term might be "functionally challenged".

Well, you're, probably, right, it sounds better.

> 
> No offence, but it's useless

It's not useless. It's a challenge. Yes, it's hard to control and keep it in one piece, but when it reaches the orbit ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> It's not useless. It's a challenge. Yes, it's hard to control and keep it in one piece, but when it reaches the orbit ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Well that took a while to respond...![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Well that took a while to respond...![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Yep ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Indeed pretty big.

How much can it lift to orbit? My [Star of Milos](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29533-What-did-you-do-in-KSP-today?p=2125604#post2125604) can carry about 90 tons.

[![screenshot10.png](http://tex.texel.com/ksp104/screenshot10.png)](http://tex.texel.com/ksp104/screenshot10.png)

> 
> Indeed pretty big.
> How much can it lift to orbit? My [Star of Milos](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29533-What-did-you-do-in-KSP-today?p=2125604#post2125604) can carry about 90 tons.
> 
> [http://tex.texel.com/ksp104/screenshot10.png](http://tex.texel.com/ksp104/screenshot10.png)

9000 of fuel and 9000 of oxidiser.

> 
> Indeed pretty big.
> How much can it lift to orbit? My [Star of Milos](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29533-What-did-you-do-in-KSP-today?p=2125604#post2125604) can carry about 90 tons.
> 
> [http://tex.texel.com/ksp104/screenshot10.png](http://tex.texel.com/ksp104/screenshot10.png)

I'm confused.

Did you use tweakscale or something? These sizes are just confusing my brain.

> 
> I'm confused.
> Did you use tweakscale or something? These sizes are just confusing my brain.

Yes, it's heavily TweakScaled. To give you an idea of scale, the cockpit, tail fins and Rhino engines have not been TweakScaled.

For details on how it was launched check the link to the original post.
